title: Israel launches strikes on Iran, risking escalation in Mideast wars
byline: Israel pounded Iran with a series of airstrikes early Saturday, saying it was targeting military targets in retaliation for the barrage of ballistic missiles the Islamic Republic fired upon Israel earlier this month.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, North-western and Northern provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Elpitiya PS Election begins
byline: The Elpitiya Pradeshiya Sabha Election has commenced at 7:00 a.m. today (26), with eight recognized political parties and an independent group competing to elect 29 members.

title: Iraq suspends all air traffic as Israel strikes Iran: state media
byline: Iraq suspended all air traffic Saturday at its airports until further notice after Israel launched air strikes against Iran.

title: After wave of airstrikes, Israel says its retaliation against Iran is complete
byline: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said that it has completed a series of airstrikes against Iranian military sites, termed “Days of Repentance,” in response to ongoing attacks from Iran, including a significant missile barrage on October 1.

title: EU reaffirms assistance to Sri Lanka in expanding market access, employment opportunities
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake met with the European Union (EU) Delegation, led by EU Ambassador H.E. Carmen Moreno, today (25) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Elpitiya PS Election: Voter turnout as at 10am
byline: The voter turnout for the Elpitiya Pradeshiya Sabha Election, which commenced across 48 centers at 7:00 a.m. today (26), has been reported as 25 percent as of 10:00 a.m., according to Galle District Returning Officer W.A. Dharmasiri.

title: Trees uprooted, power lines snapped as Cyclone Dana pummels India’s east coast
byline: A ‘severe cyclonic storm’ pounded India’s eastern coast on Friday, uprooting trees, snapping power lines and inundating some areas, authorities said, adding that no deaths or injuries were reported.

title: Preparations underway for Elpitiya PS Election
byline: The Elections Commission says that the departure of relevant officials for duties related to the 2024 Elpitiya Pradeshiya Sabha Election and the transporting of ballot papers and ballot boxes to the relevant polling centers will take place today (25).

title: Police raid illegal firearms workshop in Matara; 3 arrested with revolvers
byline: Police officers have raided a workshop where revolver-type firearms were being manufactured and arrested a suspect in the Palatuwa area in the Matara police division.

title: Tense situation near Pamunugama Police over assault of arrested youths
byline: A group of local residents had protested in front of the Pamunugama Police Station last evening (24) claiming that two youths arrested by the police were brutally assaulted.

title: Police obtain detention orders on suspects arrested over threats to Israelis
byline: Police have obtained detention orders to question three suspects arrested in connection with alleged security threats to Israeli nationals in Sri Lanka, according to Police Spokesman DIG Nihal Thalduwa.

title: Petition filed against Ranjan Ramanayake’s nomination for General Election
byline: A petition has been filed with the Supreme Court requesting an order to reject the nomination of former Member of Parliament Ranjan Ramanayake, who is contesting the upcoming general election under the “United Democratic Voice” party from the Gampaha District.

title: Donated Australian King Air arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: A former Royal Australian Air Force King Air 350 arrived in Sri Lanka on October 24 following a ferry flight from Australia.

title: Sri Lanka has long way to go to achieve strong, sustainable recovery – IMF
byline: Sri Lanka has made significant progress in implementing economic reforms, positioning itself to advance quickly toward the third review of the Sri Lanka EFF program, which is coming up soon, a senior International Monetary Fund official said on Thursday.

title: 22 students hospitalized after suddenly falling ill at school
byline: A group of female students at a school in Balangoda has been admitted to Base Hospital Balangoda due to experiencing sudden health complications.

title: President assures strengthened security protocols across Sri Lanka’s key tourist areas
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake met with the South African High Commissioner, Sandile Edwin Schalk, this morning (25) at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo.

title: EC reveals candidates’ expenditure for 2024 Presidential Election
byline: The Election Commission has made public the document detailing the expenses incurred by candidates who contested the last presidential election.

title: CSE’s ASPI crosses 12,500 points
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has crossed the 12,500 points mark today (04), for the first time since 10 May 2024.

title: Four astronauts return to Earth after being delayed by Boeing’s capsule trouble and Hurricane Milton
byline: Four astronauts returned to Earth on Friday after a nearly eight-month space station stay extended by Boeing’s capsule trouble and Hurricane Milton.

title: Argentine police raid hotel where One Direction’s Liam Payne died
byline: Argentina’s police raided the Buenos Aires hotel where ex-One Direction singer Liam Payne stayed before dying last week after falling from a third-floor balcony, a government official said Thursday.

title: Israeli strikes kill 38 people in Gaza’s Khan Younis and 3 journalists in southern Lebanon
byline: Israeli strikes killed 38 people in Gaza and three journalists in Lebanon on Friday as growing worries about supply shortages in Gaza and international pressure for a cease-fire mounted.

title: Man arrested trying to sell 10kg of ambergris for Rs. 200 million
byline: An individual has been arrested while allegedly attempting to sell 10 kilograms of ‘Ambergris’ estimated to be worth around Rs. 200 million, police said.

title: Three cops interdicted for assaulting two youths in Pamunugama
byline: Three police officers attached to the Pamunugama Police Station have been interdicted over the incident of allegedly assaulting two youths in the Pamunugama area in Wattala.

title: No businessman will be permitted to exploit situation by unfairly raising rice prices - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced that the government will support small and medium-scale rice mill owners in enhancing their capacity to help stabilize the rice market.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, North-western and Northern provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Three Chinese nationals arrested over online scams
byline: Three Chinese nationals suspected to be involved in online financial frauds have been arrested at Gintota in Galle, police said.

title: TID arrests two persons over threats to Israelis in Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka Police says two persons have been arrested by the Terrorism Investigation Division (TID) on suspicion of allegedly planning to attack Israeli nationals in Sri Lanka.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in several provinces
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern, North-western and Northern provinces and in Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: Sri Lankan Navy detains 16 Indian fishermen
byline: Sixteen Tamil Nadu fishermen were apprehended by the Sri Lankan Navy for allegedly trespassing into the territorial waters of the island nation on Wednesday evening.

title: Presidential Election candidates’ expense reports to be released today
byline: The Election Commission says that the election expense reports submitted by presidential candidates who contested for the 2024 Presidential Election will be made public from today onwards (24).

title: US says evidence shows North Korea has troops in Russia, possibly for Ukraine war
byline: The United States said for the first time on Wednesday that it had seen evidence that North Korea has sent 3,000 troops to Russia for possible deployment in Ukraine, a move that could mark a significant escalation in Russia’s war against its neighbor.

title: Giant mural in Sao Paulo uses ash from wildfires to highlight deforestation
byline: Brazilian street artist Mundano’s latest work incorporates ash from forest fires and mud from flooding in Brazil to create a giant mural pleading for a stop to deforestation.

title: Flood warnings issued for low-lying areas of Nilwala River valley
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a flood warning for several low-lying areas of Nilwala River valley, effective until 2.00 a.m. on October 26.

title: Namal Rajapaksa arrives at CID
byline: Former Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) at around 9.00 a.m. this morning to provide a statement, Ada Derana Reporter said.

title: SriLankan Airlines’ safety rating restored after addressing cockpit incident
byline: In a swift move, Airlineratings.com last week downgraded SriLankan Airlines’ safety rating from 7 to 6 stars following a disturbing incident aboard flight UL 607.

title: Sri Lanka Police introduce emergency telephone number for Israeli nationals
byline: Israeli nationals visiting Sri Lanka, whether for tourism or other purposes, can now directly request assistance to ensure personal protection, according to Sri Lankan Police.

title: Namal leaves CID after recording statement
byline: Former Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa has left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), a short while ago, after providing a statement for about two and a half hours.

title: Canada to cut immigration numbers, government source says
byline: Canada will sharply lower the number of immigrants it allows into the country for the first time in years, marking a notable shift in policy for the government as it tries to remain in power.

title: 30 injured in protests demanding Bangladeshi president resign
byline: A protest outside the Bangladeshi president’s home demanding his resignation ended when demonstrators clashed with riot police while trying to storm the compound, with 30 injured in the melee.

title: Mother sues AI chatbot company Character.AI, Google over son’s suicide
byline: A Florida mother has sued artificial intelligence chatbot startup Character.AI accusing it of causing her 14-year-old son’s suicide in February, saying he became addicted to the company’s service and deeply attached to a chatbot it created.

title: Three arrested over security threats to Israelis in Sri Lanka - Minister
byline: Three persons have been arrested so far by the police over the intelligence reports on security threats to Israeli nationals in Sri Lanka, Public Security Minister Vijitha Herath said.

title: Travel advisories for Sri Lanka can be withdrawn within 2-3 days – Minister
byline: Public Security Minister Vijitha Herath says that the travel advisories issued by several foreign countries for Sri Lanka could be lifted within the next two to three days.

title: FR petition over Grade 5 Scholarship exam fixed for consideration
byline: The Supreme Court has ordered for the Fundamental Rights (FR) petition filed seeking an order preventing the release of the 2024 Grade 05 Scholarship Examination results and the cut-off marks, to be taken up for consideration on November 18.

title: Emergency at BIA called off after another bomb scare on Vistara flight
byline: The emergency declared at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake following another bomb scare on a Vistara flight has been called off, according to the airport management.

title: President assures security of all citizens following recent intelligence reports
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has stated that the government has taken all necessary measures in response to recent intelligence reports and assures the security of all citizens.

title: India evacuates hundreds of thousands and shuts schools as tropical storm nears
byline: Indian authorities have shut schools, evacuated hundreds of thousands of people and canceled trains in parts of the country as rescue teams braced on Thursday for a tropical storm brewing in the Bay of Bengal.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern, North-western and Northern provinces and in Kandy and Nuwara-eliya districts.

title: One injured in shooting at Ratmalana railway yard
byline: A person was injured in a shooting incident at the Ratmalana railway yard in the early hours of today (23).

title: Putin hosts Global South leaders at BRICS summit meant to counterbalance Western clout
byline: China’s Xi Jinping, India’s Narendra Modi and other world leaders arrived Tuesday in the Russian city of Kazan for a summit of the BRICS bloc of developing economies that the Kremlin hopes to turn into a rallying point for defying Western influence in global affairs.

title: Former MP Lohan Ratwatte’s vehicle involved in accident
byline: A vehicle reportedly belonging to former Member of Parliament Lohan Ratwatte has been involved in an accident at the Dangahamula Junction along the Padeniya-Anuradhapura road, within the Wariyapola Police Division.

title: “Money cannot buy our opposition” – Dilith Jayaweera
byline: Leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance and Gampaha District parliamentary candidate, entrepreneur Dilith Jayaweera says that there is no strategy in the program presented by the current government.

title: CEB proposes 6% electricity tariff revision for December
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has submitted its proposal for a possible tariff revision in December to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL), marking the third quarterly review for the year.

title: Shooting reported in Ratnapura
byline: A house in the Marapana area of Ratnapura has been targeted in a shooting early this morning (26), at around 2.00 a.m.

title: McDonald’s formally ends franchise operations in Sri Lanka
byline: McDonald’s Corporation and International Restaurant Systems (Private) Limited have mutually agreed to end their franchise relationship in Sri Lanka. The companies reached a legal settlement that both parties found agreeable.

title: Elpitiya PS Election concludes with over 50% voter turnout
byline: The Elpitiya Pradeshiya Sabha Election concluded today (26) at 4.00 p.m., with a reported voter turnout of 63% at close of polling at 4:00 p.m., according to Galle District Returning Officer W.A. Dharmasiri. MORE…

title: Heavy showers above 75 mm expected in parts of the island tomorrow
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle, Matara and Mannar districts tomorrow (27), the Department of Meteorology warned.

title: Candidate’s wife assaulted during election canvassing in Pannipitiya
byline: Kanthi Kodikara, the wife of parliamentary candidate Upali Kodikara, has reportedly been attacked in Pannipitiya while she was distributing election campaign leaflets.

title: Iran raises the death toll from Israel’s attack to 4, all from its military air defense
byline: Iran has raised the death toll from Israel’s attack to four and said all served in the country’s military air defense.

title: At least 124 killed after Sudan’s RSF attack village, activists say
byline: Sudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) killed at least 124 people in a village in El Gezira State on Friday, activists said, in one of the deadliest incidents of an 18-month war and largest in a spate of attacks in the state.
